results.title: The Bowater story
results.creator_credit: Arthur Graham, Bowater and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: A story of industrial growth and enterprise - in 1926 the British company Bowater began making paper as well as selling it, and now owns mills and forests in many parts of the world including Norway, Sweden, USA, France, New Zealand and Australia.

results.title: The Heritage of the uncommon man
results.creator_credit: Reid H Ray and BNA Communications
results.brief_description: Joe Powell, a noted lecturer to businessmen, expounds his notions of the “Uncommon man” - the man who gets results. In an entertaining lecture, Powell describes the attributes and behaviour of the successful executive. Uses cartoons to illustrate some points of the lecture.

results.title: No Fixed Address: on tour
results.creator_credit: Colin South, John Tatoulis, Channel 0-28 and Media World Productions
results.brief_description: Documentary on the British tour of one of Australia’s leading rock bands, No Fixed Address, a band committed to expressing aspects of their culture and the condition of Aboriginal people through their music. Includes footage of the Brisbane Commonwealth Games protests and also examines British black music.

results.title: They found a cave
results.creator_credit: Andrew Steane, Charles E. Wolnizer and Australian Council for Children's Film and Television
results.brief_description: They found a cave: Four English orphans migrate to Tasmania under the care of their Aunt. Their Aunt becomes sick and is hospitalised, leaving the children to seek refuge in a secret cave. Excitement follows the children as they face danger and adventure in the rugged terrain before they are finally reunited with their Aunt. Based on the novel by Nan Chauncy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Steane, Charles E. Wolnizer and Australian Council for Children’s Film and Television

results.title: Free Climbing
results.brief_description:
Rock climbing is a recreation for some, an obsession for others. “Free Climbing” was filmed at Mt Arapiles and Mt Buffalo and features hair-raising shots as climbers demonstrate safety and technical skills.

Since this work was made (in 1986) there have been significant rediscoveries of indigenous cultural heritage around Mt Arapiles (2019 - 2022). Some of the climbing areas pictured may no longer be accessible due to measures to protect this heritage.

results.title: Pierre et Paul = Pierre and Paul
results.creator_credit: Rene Allio, Leon Carre and Yves Robert
results.brief_description:
Pierre, a middle manager in a building company, decides to buy a appartment and live with his girlfriend, Martine. But, the subsequent death of his father and various financial difficulties soon damage his mental equilibrium. When the May ‘68 riots errupt, Pierre goes off the rails.

Credits: Producer, Leon Carre, Yves Robert ; director, Rene Allio ; writer, Rene Allio ; photography, Georges Leclerc ; music, Jacques Dutronc.
Cast: Pierre Mondy, Robert Juillard, Bulle Ogier, Madeleine Barbulee, Helene Vincent.

results.title: Rollergirl
results.brief_description: This performance art film features bluescreen technology with the director/actor rollerskating to background images of war, weapons and military might. No dialogue - music soundtrack.

results.title: Et cetera. Episode 3 [1999 Melbourne Fringe Festival]
results.creator_credit: David McLauchlan, Michael Costello and Northern Access TV
results.brief_description:
Documents the 1999 Melbourne Fringe Festival Parade and the Fringe Furniture Exhibition, including interviews with Virginia Hyam, Fringe Director, and Axel, Fringe Furniture Co-ordinator. The Melbourne Fringe Festival has become an institution since its inception in 1982 when a small group of independent artists gathered together to create a platform to present new and independent art to the community. From those early beginnings the Melbourne-based festival now attracts interstate and international guests and covers a wide variety of arts
performances including outdoor events such as the Annual Parade in Brunswick Street, Fitzroy, the Annual Waiter’s Race, street-theatre and live bands and indoor events including comedy and cabaret, music and theatre. The Fringe Furniture Exhibition allows for young students
and designers an opportunity to show-off their creative ability and caters for non-mainstream pieces. Crazy, outrageous, quirky and even occasionally practical, the Exhibition contains an amazing selection of eclectic pieces as witnessed in this documentary program.
Reporters: Melissa Iaria and Phillip Taylor.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David McLauchlan, Michael Costello and Northern Access TV

results.title: The Poetry Cup
results.creator_credit: Terrence Doran, Ken Smeaton and Peter Lane
results.brief_description: The inaugural Poetry Cup was filmed in September at the Rochester Castle Hotel, Fitzroy as part of the 1989 Spoleto Fringe Festival. Just as the comedy resurgence began in the small cafes and clubs before moving to a wider television audience so then the poets. These people are performers with an emphasis on entertainment. No quiet reads here, but full blooded performance poetry. Their skills have been honed amid beer, smoke, pool players and football, in the back rooms of inner city hotels such as the Provincial, the Rochester, the Leicester Arms and cafes, prisons, schools and the streets.

results.title: Bernice bobs her hair
results.creator_credit: Joan Micklin Silver, Paul R. Gurian and Perspective Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
A young flapper bobs her hair to gain peer approval but she learns a lesson in values. An adaptation of the short story of the same title by F. Scott Fitzgerald.
